result.execSummary:
The defendant Doesean L Brock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Commit no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause,
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Doesean L Brock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Doesean L Brock in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 37.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Commit no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause,
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Doesean L Brock in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state. 
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Doesean L Brock in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. 

 Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to review with his client.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Doesean L Brock in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Defense counsel is awaiting to receive offer from the State.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Doesean L Brock in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer as a friend of the Court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is Public defender eligible. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM032240  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-03-15

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.R.B. dob 10-18-1999.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Doesean L Brock in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant DOES NOT want to be interviewed by the Public Defender's Office TODAY. I ALSO GAVE HIM A REFERRAL TO THE PD'S OFFICE.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/7/15 @ 1:30pm
